text:
Hi team, so straight to the point im a freelancer looking to use HubSpot, before I dedicate time on it im curious is it possible:

`Create a page on HubSpot, where the user can customise a 3D model of a car, when they select from a list of car parts it should visually update the part on the 3D model of the car. There are a lot of car companies that do this,`

Is this possible to do on HubSpot? My initial impression of HubSpot is that its really great for creating static content and then swopping it out with variables, classic CMS tool :slightly_smiling_face:  but this seems something a little more complex for HubSpot to handle. Any information would be greatly appreciated :pray:

No matter what platform this is developed on, it will require quite a bit of difficult ThreeJS (or other 3d rendering library) development to create a customizable interactive 3d model of car/parts. And this is assuming you already have working 3d models that you can load into the viewer... On the whole, a lot of work.

But yes, it can be developed as a HubSpot module.

Thanks Nich for your quick response :pray: Yeah thats a good point, perhaps as a starter just have a static image that gets swopped out but that creates a n*n problem because there can be so many variations :confused: not ideal either.

So there isnt a limitation to create a react project , use a library like threeJS and import it into HubSpot to run on a separate web page?
ThreeJS does not require react. But yes you can implement on HubSpot as react or non-reactâ€“ and import 3rd party libraries as needed

Yeah react is just more familar to me, I could just run everything on a plain javascript file but would rather not do that. Thanks Nich for all the information :pray:

I just needed to know if HubSpot has any issues running react or a 3rd party library, and it doesnt seem so :slightly_smiling_face:

Nope, you're good! As long as you know what you're doing. There are few differences to know about running react on HubSpot. I'm certainly not an expert in that area yet, but I would recommend checking this out: <https://github.HubSpot.com/cms-react/>
Thanks for the resource :slightly_smiling_face: will read through it
